content: If you disable this guest, they won’t be able to log in to {{productName}}.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message when disabling guest access in {{productName}}. If this key is translated, it will appear as a prompt informing users about the consequences of disabling guest logins.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The pronoun 'este' is repeated and sounds unnatural. It should be singular and refer to the guest.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Si desactiva a este invitado, no podrá iniciar sesión en {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ປິດການໃຊ້ງານ" (pit gaan chai ngan) is a literal translation of 'disable' and while understandable, a more natural phrasing might be 'ລົບການເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບ' (lop gaan khao suu lap bob) or 'ບໍ່ໃຫ້ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບ' (bor hai khao suu lap bob).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຖ້າເຈົ້າບໍ່ໃຫ້ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບຜູ້ຮັບແຂກນີ້, ພວກເຂົາຈະບໍ່ສາມາດເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບເຂົ້າ {{productName}} ໄດ້.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The gendered pronoun 'viņš (-a)' is used. While technically correct, it's not ideal for a system message where the gender of the guest is unknown. Using a gender-neutral pronoun or rephrasing to avoid the pronoun would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a gender-neutral option like 'viņi' or rephrasing the sentence to avoid the pronoun altogether, e.g., 'Ja atspējosiet šo viesi, pieteikšanās {{productName}} nevarēs notikt.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of 'guest' is awkward. 'Gość' implies a more casual or unwanted visitor. A more accurate translation would convey the meaning of a user account.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jeśli wyłączysz to konto gościa, nie będzie w stanie zalogować się na {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'nie będzie w stanie' is a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jeśli wyłączysz tego gościa, nie będzie mógł/mogła zalogować się na {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'conecta' (connect) doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'log in'. The correct Romanian term for 'log in' is 'autentifica' or 'se autentifica'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Dacă dezactivați un invitat, acesta nu va putea să se autentifice la {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "disable" as "අක්‍රිය කළහොත්" (akriya kalahoth) is technically correct, but a more natural and commonly used phrasing might be "අයින් කළහොත්" (ain kalahoth) or "අයින් කිරීමෙන්" (ain kirimen) when referring to removing a guest account. "අක්‍රිය කළහොත්" is more often used for deactivating features or systems, not user accounts.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ මෙම ආගන්තුකයා අයින් කළහොත් / ඔබට මෙම ආගන්තුකයා අයින් කිරීමෙන්...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While not technically incorrect, the word 'පුරනය' (puranaya) is archaic. A more contemporary term would be 'ඇතුළු වීමට' (athułu varmita).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ මෙම ආගන්තුකයා අයින් කළහොත්, ඔවුන්ට {{productName}} වෙත ඇතුළු වීමට නොහැකි වනු ඇත.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'oturum açamazlar' (cannot log in) is accurate but sounds somewhat formal and indirect. A more natural and user-friendly phrasing would be more appropriate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bu konuğu devre dışı bırakırsanız, {{productName}}’e giriş yapamazlar.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'e' was added in the suggestion, following Turkish grammar rules after the product name. This should be consistent with the English usage of 'to'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: This is a clarification of the suggested correction rather than a change.
